Role Overview:


	The Project Management Director (PMD) is a senior leadership role responsible for the end-to-end construction delivery of complex energy infrastructure projects, with a specific focus on.
	renewable energy (solar, wind, hydro) and natural gas/flexibility assets (LNG, CCGT, IPP) developments.
	The role oversees all aspects of project design, engineering, construction, commissioning, and handover.
	As a strategic and operational leader, the Project Director ensures that all projects are accurately designed with zero error margin, delivered on time, within the designed scope, on budget, and in full compliance with environmental, safety, and regulatory standards.
	The role also provides technical leadership in project feasibility, concept development, and stakeholder coordination from pre-financial Close through Commercial Operation Date and operations transfer.


Key Area of Focus
Detailed Project Engineering Design &amp; Development:


	Detailed project engineering design with 100% accuracy of designs at all times, project implementation and construction to ensure the least capital and subsequent operating costs with effective post-commissioning performance.
	Project management and reporting.
	Coordinate all activities from detailed engineering design to implementation, including RFP (request for proposals) and EPC selection processes


&nbsp;Project Execution &amp; Construction:


	Manage EPC contractors and provide supervisory oversight to our in-house firm (BuildAngle) and ensure construction milestones are achieved a designed and contracted.
	Supervise contractor performance and quality assurance/control procedures.
	Enforce health, safety, and environmental (HSE) compliance on-site.


Budget &amp; Schedule Management:


	&nbsp;Develop and manage project budgets and delivery schedules.
	&nbsp;Mitigate project risks and resolve delays, scope changes, and cost overruns.
	&nbsp;Report regularly to EVP Technical Services and other stakeholders on project KPIs.


Stakeholder Management:


	Liaise with utilities, regulatory agencies, investors, and government bodies.
	Ensure effective communication and transparency to all project stakeholders.
	Support local content and community engagement program.
	Ideal Candidate Profile
	Certifications: Project Management, such as PMP&reg;, Prince2&reg;, or equivalent

	Sector Focus: Demonstrated experience with utility-scale renewable and gas infrastructure projects in developing/emerging markets
	Geographic Mobility: Willingness to work in diverse geographies with extended travel as needed, with strong leadership in a multicultural project environment.


Method of Application&nbsp;

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Copywriter",
  "description": "Accelerate is the youth haven for the cool kids, creatives, doers, thinkers and everyone in between. We have built a reputation on being a consistent source of information and inspiration in the fashion, music and entertainment culture of Nigeria/African, both on the continent and beyond.

As a multi media outlet we pride ourselves in Entertaining, Educating and Empowering our audience by documenting Nigerian/African stories and pop culture, all the while keeping a close eye on the establishment and championing the new.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Copywriter

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job&nbsp;Description


	The Copywriter / Social Media Manager is responsible for developing compelling brand stories and managing the company&rsquo;s digital and social media presence across platforms.
	This hybrid role requires both creative writing expertise and strategic digital management skills to craft engaging, brand-aligned content that drives awareness, engagement, and conversion.
	The ideal candidate is a strong communicator, storyteller, and trend-savvy professional who can ideate, write, edit, and distribute impactful content while building and managing a cohesive brand identity across all online channels.


Key Responsibilities
Content Development &amp; Copywriting:


	Write, edit, and proofread clear, compelling, and original copy for multiple platforms, including social media, websites, blogs, newsletters, marketing campaigns, and video scripts.
	Collaborate with designers, videographers, and the creative team to develop high-impact campaigns and multimedia content.
	Ensure all content aligns with the brand&rsquo;s tone, style, and messaging guidelines.
	Translate complex ideas into relatable, audience-friendly stories and captions.
	Create SEO-driven web and blog content to improve organic visibility and audience engagement.
	Adapt messaging for various formats long-form storytelling, ad copy, taglines, and short-form captions.


Social Media Strategy &amp; Management:


	Develop and implement a comprehensive social media strategy to increase brand visibility, engagement, and audience growth.
	Plan, create, and schedule content across platforms such as Instagram, X (Twitter), LinkedIn, TikTok, Facebook, and YouTube.
	Monitor trends, conversations, and competitor activity to inform creative direction and optimize performance.
	Engage actively with online audiences &mdash; respond to comments, messages, and brand mentions in a timely and professional manner.
	Collaborate with the marketing and creative teams to run campaigns, contests, influencer collaborations, and live activations.
	Maintain a consistent posting calendar and ensure content relevance to current events and brand campaigns.


Analytics &amp; Performance Tracking:


	Monitor key performance metrics (engagement rates, impressions, follower growth, reach, etc.) and prepare regular social media performance reports.
	Use insights and analytics to refine strategies, identify opportunities, and improve audience engagement.
	Stay updated with platform algorithm changes, trends, and emerging best practices.


Brand Voice &amp; Campaign Execution:


	Maintain a unified brand tone and personality across all digital communications.
	Contribute to the creative development of advertising and marketing campaigns (concept development, taglines, scripts, etc.).
	Collaborate with internal departments (Agency, Studios, and Phoenix Project) to develop content that supports cross-functional campaigns and initiatives.
	Support external brand partnerships by creating promotional and partnership copy.


Digital Coordination &amp; Team Collaboration:


	Work closely with the creative team to ensure cohesive storytelling between visuals and copy.
	Support the production team with scriptwriting for social videos, short films, and branded content.
	Assist with content uploads and asset management for websites, newsletters, and streaming platforms.


Performance Indicators


	Growth in audience engagement and brand visibility
	Quality, originality, and consistency of content
	Timeliness and reliability in content delivery
	Positive audience feedback and brand sentiment
	Achievement of campaign and engagement KPIs
	Alignment of copy and messaging with brand objectives.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Communications, English, Journalism, Marketing, or a related field.
	4 &ndash; 6 years of experience as a Copywriter, Social Media Manager, or similar role in an agency, media, or creative environment.
	Proven experience managing social media accounts and delivering measurable results.
	Exceptional writing, editing, and storytelling skills.
	Strong understanding of brand communication, tone, and audience segmentation.
	Familiarity with SEO, analytics tools (Meta Business Suite, Google Analytics, etc.), and content scheduling platforms (Hootsuite, Later, Buffer, or Sprout Social).
	Basic graphic or video editing skills are an added advantage (Canva, CapCut, Adobe Express, etc.).


Key Competencies:


	Strong creative and strategic thinking
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
	Trend awareness and digital curiosity
	Attention to detail and content accuracy
	Ability to multitask and manage deadlines under pressure
	Data-driven decision making
	Brand storytelling and voice development
	Collaboration and teamwork.

Job Position: Visual Designer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the job


	The Visual Designer is responsible for creating visually engaging, brand-consistent, and user-centered designs across multiple platforms , including digital, social media, web, print, and motion.
	This role requires a balance of creative innovation and technical precision, ensuring that every visual output enhances the brand&rsquo;s storytelling and communicates messages effectively.
	The ideal candidate combines creativity, strategic thinking, and design excellence, with the ability to transform abstract concepts and marketing objectives into striking visual experiences.


Key Responsibilities
Brand Design &amp; Identity:


	Develop and maintain consistent brand aesthetics across all visual assets.
	Create and refine design elements such as logos, icons, typography, color palettes, and graphic styles.
	Ensure brand guidelines are properly implemented across all platforms and materials.
	Contribute to the evolution and modernization of the brand&rsquo;s visual identity.

	Design visually compelling layouts for social media, websites, email newsletters, digital campaigns, and motion graphics.

	Collaborate with copywriters and marketing teams to develop cohesive campaign visuals.
	Adapt designs across multiple formats and screen sizes while maintaining quality and clarity.


Motion &amp; Multimedia Design:


	Develop simple animations, transitions, and motion graphics for videos, social media, and advertisements.
	Support video editors and the production team with lower-thirds, graphic overlays, and visual effects.
	Maintain visual consistency across still and motion assets.


Collaboration &amp; Cross-Functional Support:


	Work closely with the Art Director, Creative Director, and Content team to ensure visual cohesion across campaigns.
	Partner with Marketing, Product, and Social Media teams to deliver visually compelling assets on tight deadlines.
	Participate in brainstorming sessions and contribute fresh, creative ideas to campaigns and content projects.
	Ensure all design outputs meet brand, creative, and strategic goals.


Quality Control &amp; File Management:


	Maintain organized design files, templates, and asset libraries for internal use.
	Ensure all visual materials meet technical specifications for print, web, and motion.
	Review designs for errors before publishing or printing.


Performance Indicators


	Quality, originality, and effectiveness of design output
	Timeliness in delivering creative assets
	Consistency in maintaining brand standards
	Stakeholder satisfaction and creative alignment
	Contribution to brand visibility and audience engagement


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Graphic Design, Visual Communication, Fine Arts, or a related field.
	4&ndash;5 years of experience in visual design, preferably within a media, digital, or creative agency environment.
	Strong proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, After Effects, XD) and familiarity with Figma or Canva.
	Solid understanding of layout design, typography, color theory, and visual hierarchy.
	Experience designing for both digital and print media.
	Knowledge of basic animation and motion graphics is an added advantage.
	A strong portfolio showcasing creative versatility and attention to detail.

	Creative thinking and problem-solving skills
	Strong visual storytelling and aesthetic judgment
	Excellent attention to detail and accuracy
	Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple projects simultaneously
	Effective collaboration and communication skills
	Adaptability to feedback and brand direction
	Awareness of design trends, emerging technologies, and industry best practices.
